title: The Dolphins’ Offense Can Break the Dam (If They Fix These Two Leaks)
subtitle: Personnel is elite; sequencing and situational calls aren’t. Two fixes.
body:
# TL;DR
Miami is *this* close. The talent is unquestioned. The issues are sequencing on early downs and fourth-down decision-making when EPA says go.

## Leak #1: Early-down predictability
Too much outside zone on 1st & 10 from neutral scripts. Mix in motion-to-bunch and RPO glance on 1st down to punish static light boxes.

## Leak #2: Fourth-down conservatism
Inside the opponent 45, 4th-and-<3 with a healthy offense should be automatic. Stretch the field horizontally to create a yak throw.

- Script 1: Tyreek jet orbit to move the apex; run split-zone insert back the other way.
- Script 2: Fast-4 strong; return to leak flat. Free yards.

```
“You don’t fix identity—just the timings that reveal it.”
```

## What I want to see next week
- +10% RPO rate on 1st down
- Reduce outside zone rate by 8–12% in neutral scripts
- Leverage motion to force static coverage tells early

title: Wizards Rant: Stop Pretending ‘Rebuild’ Means Vibes
subtitle: Draft capital without a player-development spine is just hoarding.
body:
# TL;DR
Asset accumulation ≠ development. The Wizards need a coherent player archetype, two pet actions, and a defensive baseline.

## Archetype
Long, fast, multi-positional wings with real handle. Draft for two-way upside, not just tools.

## Pet actions
- Horns Twist into empty-corner PnR for your lead handler.
- Chicago into Spain, but emphasize the *slip* to punish switches.

## Baseline defense
Drop with weak-side low man pre-loaded. You can’t switch everything without switchable talent.

## KPI to track
- Advantage creation rate per halfcourt possession
- Shot quality delta vs opponent (location eFG)
- Player dev minutes in two-man actions (not garbage time)
